channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024081403
item.description:
Report X-2024081403

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: During sort operations at the MSPA location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a glass bottle packaged with styrofaom molds top and bottom. The glas bottle was broken and all contents spilled inside of the fiberboard box. A packing slip inside identified the contents as dimethyl sulfoxide as a UN2810. There were no DG markings or paperwork on the outside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Spill noticed in trailer prior to unloading, team recognized that half of a tote was missing and called our consultant Hazmat ONE. Team responded for cleanup and put all waste into three 55 gallon drums from the material that was cleaned up from the trailer and ground. No drains or soil was impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024080213
item.description:
Report E-2024080213

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: FERRISBURG
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG MERCHANT GAS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 735000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC unit was traveling on Route 7 in Ferrisburgh, Vermont. It is suspected that a fire started in one of the rear wheels on the tractor that quickly spread to the trailer. Due to the fire and heat, the trailer began to vent the natural gas it was holding. The local fire department was eventually able extinguish the fire. The tractor and trailer suffered significant damage as a result of the fire.

item.title: Report I-2024060038
item.description:
Report I-2024060038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: BISHOPVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FLORIDA TRANSFORMER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Due to force from acceleration or deceleration, a ratchet handle or a metal binder handle punctured the tote causing it to release its contents. The location of the puncture is thought to be about halfway up the tote. The duration of the release was along approximately 6 miles of highway. Emergency Response services were initiated, absorbent was applied to the roadway and traffic control was administered where needed. The trailer and any evidence of spillage was cleaned.

item.title: Report I-2024070092
item.description:
Report I-2024070092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: LAKE ARIEL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 132700
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver made reversed hose connections to tractor mounted product pump. This caused the pump to draft from the receiving AST and into the transport trailer, ultimately overfilling the compartment, filling the vapor system, and releasing to the ground. The compartment dome lid was forced up due to pressure releasing larger amount until pump could be stopped. Product flowed by natura gravity to a retention pond adjacent to the AST delivery area. Lewis Environmental responded for remediation of ground and affected water retention pond.

item.title: Report E-2024080384
item.description:
Report E-2024080384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: WEST DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 95000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On August 5, 2024, at 1631 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Des Moines, Iowa regarding the release of Lactic Acid (UN3265, 8, III). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Lactic Acid (UN3265, Corrosive Liquid, acidic, organic, n.o.s., 8, III) from (9) 275-gallon IBC plastic totes. The release was caused by a rollover accident and impacted the trailer floor, and an area of soil. Contractors placed neutralizer and absorbents on the soil in preparation for remedial and restorative activities, and the totes and trailer were transported to a nearby tow facility. At the tow facility there was an additional release of material that impacted a trail of concrete and the inside of a roll-off. Contractors neutralized, and cleaned all impacted areas with absorbents, then transferred the remaining product from the damaged totes into new totes. All waste was collected and containerized in (11) 55-gallon DF’s and (9) 275-gallon IBC plastic totes, then staged onsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024080045
item.description:
Report I-2024080045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-28
  • City: Medford
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OAK HARBOR FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading an IBC, the body was pushed against an electrical strut which punctured the IBC. Medford fire was called, after responding they evaluated the situation and left shortly after. A 3rd party clean up crew was brought in for clean up and disposal. ACT environmental suggested that our employees evacuate the building until the area was safe.

item.title: Report I-2024080005
item.description:
Report I-2024080005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: BARNWELL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ASSOCIATED PETROLEUM CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 158928
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Vehicle was traveling east on S-06-190 (Yenome Rd). Vehicle traveled off right side of the roadway, overturned to the right. the driver crawled to the roadside where a passerby found him. The unknown passerby called and reported the incident to 911. The dome lid of the #5 compartment leaked Jet A fuel 8 hours and 22minutes. Approximately 3,238 LGA leaked into a contained area on the ground. Pametto Wrecker Service and Terracon Consultants, Inc mitigated the release.

item.title: Report X-2024072461
item.description:
Report X-2024072461

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: WOODWARD
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 109565
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: 1. X-2024072461 :CTCX 725083 was involved in a derailment in Woodward, Ok. CTCX 725083 sustained a puncture to the B end top of the tank car. The puncture caused CTCX 725083 to release product. 2.X-2024072462: CTCX 725236 was involved in a mainline derailment on 7/11/2024. CTCX 725236 tank shell was punctured on the B end left side of the car. The puncture sustained to CTCX 725236 caused product to release.

item.title: Report I-2024070114
item.description:
Report I-2024070114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: EAST CHICAGO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRADEBE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 24, 2024 a Tradebe Transportation driver made a customer pickup at the customer's location: Chem Processing INC, 3910 Linden Oaks Drive, Rockford, IL. After the driver returned to Tradebe Treatment and Recycling at 4343 Kennedy Avenue, East Chicago, IN the receiving supervisor noted that one of the totes was empty and that 200-250 gallons of material in the tote was released, It was determined that the material loaded in behind the tote shifted in transit and damaged the bottom valve causing the material to spill. The overall root cause was that the load was not blocked and braced properly.
